in a mood

What is this?

A simple app that answers one question: what's the current mood in New York City?

How does it work?

The “mood” is calculated by fetching the latest Tweets from the NYC area then passing them to the Google Cloud Natural Language API.


The Natural Language API returns a number representing the sentiment, from -1 (negative) to 1 (positive).


This number is then converted to a color based on a gradient scale and shown in the center of the mood ring. The outer mood ring color is random – to capture the true spirit of mood rings, of course.

Limitations

TL;DR This is less an accurate gauge of mood and more a technical demonstration of how it could be done.


Due to limitations in free usage of the Google API, each Tweet sample size is small. Also, rather than analyzing the sentiment of each Tweet individually, the text is analyzed as an aggregate.


Analyzing the Tweets individually would be more accurate and would allow better usage of another value returned by the Language API, the magnitude, which measures the overall emotion present in the text. Using this value with individual analyses would allow ruling out emotionally neutral Tweets.


Technologies: JavaScript, D3.js, Twitter API, Google Cloud Natural Language API, SQLite3, SVG
